result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenny K Carr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO CTS 2 & 3:
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling. Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Any bail on deposit to be applied.
No firearms; weapons. Due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

timeConds.notes: AS TO BOTH CTS: This time is stayed pending a review on 7-18-14.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenny K Carr
Current: PO Box 340292, Milwaukee, WI 53234-0292 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2015)
Prior: 4353 N 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States

Defendant Kenny K Carr in court.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE, with credit for 4 days time served.  

As to Count 3:
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE, with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 07/18/14.     
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Any bail on deposit to be applied.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Victim Impact Statement.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenny K Carr in court with attorney Mark G Lipscomb.  Ryan Sanson for Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Count 1 is dismissed, but read in for purposes of sentencing.

As to Counts 2 & 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-29-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenny K Carr in court with attorney Mark G Lipscomb.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not be heard on today's date due to court calendar congestion.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
